newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Aimless Australian stocks drift lower at open.
newsitem.headline: Aimless Australian stocks drift lower at open.

text.p: The Australian share market drifted lower at the open on Thursday, lacking any inspiration from offshore and with some mild profit-taking after Wednesday's strong close.
In early trade, the All Ordinaries index slipped 6.6 points to be at 2,277.6. The September share index futures dipped two points to 2282 and was at a 4.4 point premium to the index.
Brokers said they did not expect any real direction to emerge with little to inspire investors and with August series options expiring.
"I don't think it's going anywhere today," said a Sydney broker.
"We had a surprising run yesterday afternoon and now some people are taking profits."
The broker suggested that among individual stocks, the leaders may see some to-ing and fro-ing as options close out.
"It's options expiry so you may see some of the leaders pushed around a bit later on," he said.
Star performer early was gas utility AGL whose shares surged to a record high after reporting a 32 percent higher full year net profit of A$124.3 million.
Falls outnumbered rises by a ratio of about five to four, while about 43 percent of stock traded remained steady.
